news_header: Russia plans to contest the confiscation of its state assets in Finland, following actions by Ukrainian company Naftogaz.
news_text: Helsinki has reported the confiscation of Russian state-owned properties in Finland, including a seaside site in Häggesböle and another in Siuntio. In response, Russia intends to take legal action to contest these seizures, as stated by Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov. The confiscations are part of a broader legal context involving Naftogaz, which has been awarded over €5 billion in compensation from Russia by the Hague International Arbitration Forum. Finland may be the first country to implement such asset seizures against Russia.
